data.title: The 95+ Best Movies With Point in the Title
data.meta_description: Over 50 filmgoers have voted on the 95+ Best Movies With Point in the Title. Current Top 3: Point Blank, Vantage Point, Point Break
data.text:
How many movies with point in the title can you name? This list ranks the best movies with point in the name, whether they're documentaries, dramas, horror movies, or any other genre of film. Do you have a favorite movie with point in the title? Categorizing movies by words in their titles is kind of uncommon, but that's a big part of why this list is so fun to scroll through. There's probably one movie with point in the title you think of right away, but you might be shocked to see how many others exist as well.

Notable films with point in the title include Point Break, Match Point, and Vantage Point, although there are many more examples on this list. This poll is interactive, meaning you can vote the point movies up or down depending on how much you like them.

Lee Marvin, Angie Dickinson, Keenan Wynn

This iconic crime thriller is widely regarded as one of the best movies of the 1960s, featuring a career-defining performance by Lee Marvin. Seeking vengeance after being betrayed and left for dead, Marvin's character embarks on a violent quest to retrieve his share of stolen money. Point Blank showcases a distinctively gritty visual style and a taut script, making it a must-watch classic of American cinema.

Released : 1967

Directed by : John Boorman

Also ranks # 11 on 12 Movies Where Everything Comes Full Circle By The End

Also ranks # 10 on 16 Underrated Revenge Movies Where The Hero Goes Scorched-Earth

Also ranks # 37 on The Best Buddy Cop Movies

Dennis Quaid, Matthew Fox, Forest Whitaker

In an action-packed political thriller, Vantage Point tells the story of an assassination attempt on the President of the United States during a public event in Spain. The film brilliantly presents the same incident from eight different perspectives, masterfully weaving each storyline together while keeping the viewer in suspense. With an all-star cast and explosive plot twists, this movie is an absolute treat for fans of the genre.

Released : 2008

Directed by : Pete Travis

Also ranks # 25 on The Best Movies About Plotting A Murder

Also ranks # 48 on The 50+ Best Action Movies To Watch Stoned

Also ranks # 48 on The 60+ Best Movies About The President

Patrick Swayze, Keanu Reeves, Gary Busey

An adrenaline-fueled action film, Point Break follows a young FBI agent's undercover pursuit of a group of adrenaline-junkie surfers suspected of robbing banks. Critics have praised the movie for its breathtaking action sequences, engaging characters, and the thrilling camaraderie between the two leads. This cult classic's exhilarating blend of surfing, skydiving, and chase sequences cements its place among the best of the genre.

Released : 1991

Directed by : Kathryn Bigelow

Dig Deeper Things About Point Break That Are Too Weird Not To Address

And Deeper The Best 'Point Break' Quotes, Ranked

Also ranks # 97 on Movies That Should Never Be Remade

Scarlett Johansson, Jonathan Rhys-Meyers, Emily Mortimer

Woody Allen's stylish crime drama follows a social-climbing tennis instructor who becomes entangled in a dangerous web of lust, lies, and murder. Match Point has been hailed as one of Allen's finest films, blending shades of film noir with his trademark wit, humor, and psychological insight. The lush London setting and stellar performances from the ensemble cast make this a riveting exploration of ambition and guilt.

Released : 2005

Directed by : Woody Allen

Also ranks # 227 on The 200+ Best Psychological Thrillers Of All Time

Also ranks # 393 on The Best Movies Roger Ebert Gave Four Stars

Also ranks # 47 on The Best Movies of 2005

Barry Newman, Cleavon Little, Charlotte Rampling

Set amidst the stunning backdrop of the American Southwest, Vanishing Point tells the story of a car delivery driver who becomes a folk hero when he attempts to cross the country in record time. Along the way, he encounters a colorful cast of misfits and outlaws whilst being pursued by a relentless highway patrolman. With its breathtaking desert landscapes, rebellious spirit, and high-speed car chases, Vanishing Point has secured its status as a cult classic in the road movie genre.

Released : 1971

Directed by : Allen Smithee

Also ranks # 10 on The Best Car Movies From The '70s

Also ranks # 7 on 16 Great Chase Movies Where Lovable Outlaws Are On The Run From Justice

Also ranks # 10 on 17 Movies Where The Whole Plot Revolves Around A Big Bet

6

Point Blank

Mickey Rourke, Danny Trejo, James Gammon

In this intense action thriller, a man framed for murder must escape from a high-security prison to clear his name, uncovering a web of conspiracy in the process. With plenty of thrilling fight sequences and plot twists, Point Blank delivers a fast-paced ride that keeps audiences on the edge of their seats. The combination of clever storytelling and relentless action makes it an enjoyable watch for fans of the genre.

Released : 1998

Directed by : Matt Earl Beesley
